abstract: AT&T said Friday that it would take a $1 billion noncash accounting charge in the first quarter because of the health care overhaul and that it might cut benefits it offers to current and retired workers.
snippet: AT&T said Friday that it would take a $1 billion noncash accounting charge in the first quarter because of the health care overhaul and that it might cut benefits it offers to current and retired workers.
lead_paragraph: AT&T said Friday that it would take a $1 billion noncash accounting charge in the first quarter because of the health care overhaul and that it might cut benefits it offers to current and retired workers, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: AT&T to Take $1 Billion Charge for Health Care
